metadata.Title: CVE-2022-37032 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds read in the BGP daemon of FRRouting FRR before 8.4 may lead to a segmentation fault and denial of service. This occurs in bgp_capability_msg_parse in bgpd/bgp_packet.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-37032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 8.1-1ubuntu3
frr-pythontools - 8.1-1ubuntu3
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 8.1-1ubuntu3
frr-snmp - 8.1-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> code is similar in quagga, probably vulnerable the frr patch for this issue is incompatible with quagga, as is requires the size of the struct to be changed: https://github.com/FRRouting/frr/commit/a46a2e9b4e8de782ac07e01429a80ed7ec167dcb changing the size of that struct causes s390x to fail tests.

criterions.comment: frr package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1-1ubuntu3').
